discoveredAssets: localhost:8081 - Django 4.2 Art Gallery e-commerce (WSGIServer Python 3.13.3) - Port 8081
/accounts/login/ - User authentication login endpoint - Requires username/email and password
/accounts/register/step1/ - Multi-step registration step 1 - Collects user name and password
/accounts/register/step2/ - Multi-step registration step 2 - Session-based state management
/accounts/register/step3/ - Multi-step registration step 3 - Final registration step
/accounts/home/ - Authenticated user home page - Login required
/accounts/preferences/ - User account settings page - Login required
/accounts/logout/ - Session termination endpoint - Redirects to home
/static/ - Static files directory (CSS, JS, images) - Bootstrap 4.x, jQuery 3.5.1 libraries

targets.objective: Test authentication bypass, credential enumeration, brute force resistance, CSRF token validation, SQL injection in username field, NoSQL injection if applicable, and session management vulnerabilities
targets.rationale: Critical authentication endpoint. DEBUG mode enabled exposes detailed error messages. Potential for credential attacks, injection vulnerabilities, and session exploitation

targets.objective: Test multi-step workflow validation, session fixation, race conditions across steps, step skipping/bypass, SQL injection in name field, password validation bypass (minlength=10), and CSRF on form submission
targets.rationale: Multi-step registration with session-based state. Potential for workflow bypass attacks, race conditions between concurrent requests to different steps, and session manipulation

targets.objective: Test step workflow bypass, race condition vulnerability by sending concurrent requests to step2 and step3, session state validation, and logic flaws in multi-step registration
targets.rationale: Intermediate registration step with potential race condition vulnerabilities if concurrent requests are not properly sequenced. No direct access control observed

targets.objective: Test step bypass to complete registration without step1/step2, race condition attacks, and final registration validation logic
targets.rationale: Final registration step. Critical logic flaw testing needed for workflow bypass and race condition exploitation

targets.objective: Test authorization bypass (accessing other users' preferences), horizontal privilege escalation, IDOR vulnerabilities in user ID parameters, CSRF on preference modifications, XSS in user input fields, and sensitive data exposure
targets.rationale: Protected endpoint for user account settings. HIGH risk for IDOR and privilege escalation attacks based on typical Django implementation patterns

targets.objective: Test authorization bypass, content access control, and potential information disclosure in authenticated user dashboard
targets.rationale: Authenticated user homepage. Test proper authorization and authentication enforcement

targets.objective: Test CSRF vulnerability on GET logout (logout via GET request without token), session termination validation, and logout flow security
targets.rationale: Logout endpoint may be vulnerable to CSRF if implemented with GET method. Test session cleanup and token validation

targets.objective: Test for stored XSS in art gallery product names/descriptions, CSRF vulnerabilities, HTTP method security (DELETE, PUT), and information disclosure through error messages in DEBUG mode
targets.rationale: Main application page with DEBUG=True enabled. Detailed error pages expose URLconf and application structure. Primary attack surface for testing general web vulnerabilities

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] DEBUG mode enabled - Detailed error pages expose Django URLconf, settings, and application structure information
[CRITICAL] Multi-step registration with potential race condition vulnerability - Concurrent requests to registration steps may bypass validation
[HIGH] /accounts/login/ endpoint likely vulnerable to credential enumeration and brute force attacks - No rate limiting observed
[HIGH] /accounts/preferences/ endpoint has potential IDOR vulnerability - User ID/email may be modifiable in requests
[HIGH] GET-based CSRF vulnerability possible on /accounts/logout/ - Logout may be triggered without CSRF token
[MEDIUM] Multi-step registration relies solely on session-based validation - Session fixation or hijacking could bypass steps
[MEDIUM] Django 4.2 with WSGIServer running on localhost - Potential for local attack escalation if access to localhost is gained
[MEDIUM] Verbose error messages in 404 pages reveal URL patterns and application structure - Aids attackers in reconnaissance
[LOW] Proper security headers implemented - X-Frame-Options: DENY, X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff configured correctly
[LOW] CSRF token protection present on POST endpoints - Token properly set in response headers and validated
